metadata.title: CVE-2009-0800 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple "input validation flaws" in the JBIG2 decoder in Xpdf 3.02pl2 andearlier, CUPS 1.3.9 and earlier, Poppler before 0.10.6, and other productsallow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted PDF file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2009-0800` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xpdf - 3.02-2
No subscription required

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
libpoppler43 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
poppler-utils - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xpdf package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.02-2').
poppler package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.10.5-1ubuntu2').
